channel.title: Ssh on Coding notes - and snippets
channel.description: Recent content in Ssh on Coding notes - and snippets

item.title: Managing Multiple SSH Keys for Different GitHub Accounts
item.description: Goal Use different SSH keys for multiple GitHub accounts on the same machine. Generate SSH Key Pairs cd ~/.ssh ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "bustroker@email.com" -f "github_bustroker" ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "bkr@email.com" -f "github_bkr" This creates: ~/.ssh/github_bustroker ~/.ssh/github_bustroker.pub ~/.ssh/github_bkr ~/.ssh/github_bkr.pub Configure SSH cd ~/.ssh/ touch config nano config Add host aliases for each account: ##bustroker account Host github.com-bustroker HostName github.com User git IdentityFile ~/.ssh/github_bustroker ##bkr account Host github.com-bkr HostName github.com User git IdentityFile ~/.
